learning_outcomes.description: Identify current and/or long-standing educational trends

Recognise and understand the place of legislative, school and employing authority requirements in the teaching and learning process, and which enable strategies to support student well-being and safety.

Demonstrate knowledge of relevant codes of practices and reflection on the technical and communication skills required to interact effectively and sensitively with students, parents/care givers and fellow professionals in an educational environment.
Demonstrate clear, fluent, and coherent communication skills consistent with personal, professional and academic conventions.
Demonstrate all teaching and professional requirements of the professional experience placement.

assessments.task_description:
Students must read the Policies and Procedures for Professional Experience Placements document and respond to the statement declaration on Blackboard by the due date. Failure to do so will result in a withdrawal of the placement and the awarding of a grade of Fail for the course. 

APST: 7.1, 7.2

Statement:

I have read, understood and will abide by, the 2026 Policies and Procedures for Professional Experience Placements.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Completion of declaration statement on Blackboard to acknowledge that the student has read, understood and will abide by the policies and procedures.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: Late submission of assessment without approved extension request via myUQ system will result in a failing grade.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.assessment_title: Research Essay on an Educational Practice
assessments.task_description:
Throughout this course, current and long-standing educational trends have been explored and discussed. For this 1500-word research essay you are to investigate an educational practice that relates to one of the following areas:

  • Approaches to teaching and learning (1.1, 1.2, 2.1)
  • Developing literacy and numeracy skills (2.5)
  • Differentiation in the classroom (1.5)
  • Behaviour management (4.3)
  • Student participation and engagement (4.1, 4.4)
  • Approaches to/strategies for assessment (5.1)


In your essay, you should also evaluate the impact of the educational practice on student learning. You are required to refer to relevant academic literature and educational policy documents throughout your essay. APA referencing should be used and a reference list included. The Australian Professional Standards for Teachers listed next to each area above should also be referred to when preparing your essay.

The following may act as stimulus for choosing an educational practice: workshop discussions; articles and discussions in the media/public domain; your logbook of reflections.

APST: 1.1, 1.2, 1.5, 2.1, 2.5, 4.1, 4.3, 4.4, 5.1
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Late submission of assessment without approved extension request via myUQ system will result in a failing grade.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Students are required to successfully complete a 10 day (2 week block) supervised and assessed professional experience in an approved school setting. The placement will be arranged only by the School of Education.

 

The professional experience placement will comprise of observations and hand-on classroom assistance.

During the practicum, students are expected to demonstrate competence across the APST. To do this, students will demonstrate that they have undertaken the inherent requirements of the role of a teacher. This means that students at the very least, will be expected to:

  • Attend the school at least half an hour before and after school start and finish times to discuss that day's and subsequent days' expectations
  • Attend any meetings held during the time of the practicum, e.g. departmental or whole of staff meetings or any professional development meetings where attendance is approved by the school,
  • Participate in extracurricular activities etc available during the block.

 

Students are expected to have read, and abide by the School of Education Policies & Procedures document for Professional Experience Placements.

APST: 1.1, 2.1, 2.5, 4.2, 6.3, 7.1, 7.2
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: Late submission of assessment without approved extension will result in a failing grade.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
During your professional experience placement, you are required to keep a logbook of reflections based on your school observations.

For each of the 10 school visits you will complete a daily entry of 300 words (in paragraph form) summarising your observation notes for the topics listed below:

  • Topic 1 - Physical, social and intellectual development and characteristics of students and how these may affect learning
  • Topic 2 – How students learn and the implications for teaching
  • Topic 3 – Strategies for differentiating teaching to meet the specific learning needs of students across the full range of abilities
  • Topic 4 – Concepts, substance and structure of the content and teaching strategies of the teaching area
  • Topic 5 - Literacy and numeracy teaching strategies and their application in teaching areas
  • Topic 6 – Strategies to support inclusive student participation and engagement in classroom activities
  • Topic 7 – Practical approaches to manage challenging behaviour; and strategies that support students’ wellbeing and safety working within school and/or system, curriculum and legislative requirements
  • Topic 8 – Assessment strategies, including informal and formal, diagnostic, formative and summative approaches to assess student learning
  • Topic 9 - The role of the Australian Professional Standards for Teachers in identifying and planning professional learning needs; and the relevant and appropriate sources of professional learning for teachers to improve practice
  • Topic 10 - Strategies for working effectively, sensitively and confidentially with parents/carers


While each entry will mainly comprise of a summary of your school based discussions and research, where possible you should also consider the following across your 10 entries: Material covered in the workshop and group discussions. Current information presented in the media and public domain about the topic (for example, media articles or reports); Literature relating to the topic (for example, academic research and educational policy documents).

Each entry should include a heading with the topic number and the topic title. APA referencing should be used and a reference list included. Any documents, articles, resources or information collected can be presented via an appendix at the end of the logbook.

APST: 1.1, 1.2, 1.5, 2.1, 2.5, 4.1, 4.3, 4.4, 5.1, 6.1, 6.2, 7.3

learning_activities.topic:
Introduction to the course and the placement

In this initial seminar we will introduce:

  • the aims for your professional growth in this course,
  • the professional experience placement, including the legislative, school and employing authority requirements, and ethical principles and practices,
  • the course content and assessments.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_title: Introduction to the course and the placement
learning_activities.topic_description: Introduction to the course and the placement In this initial seminar we will introduce: the aims for your professional growth in this course, the professional experience placement, including the legislative, school and employing authority requirements, and ethical principles and practices, the course content and assessments.

learning_activities.topic:
Understanding the development and characteristics of students

This week we will focuses understanding the development and characteristics of primary school aged children, and the implications for their learning. We will explore physical, social and intellectual development and how changes in understanding have influenced educational practices over the years. (APST 1.1)


Learning outcomes: L01, L04
learning_activities.topic_title: Understanding the development and characteristics of students
learning_activities.topic_description: Understanding the development and characteristics of students This week we will focuses understanding the development and characteristics of primary school aged children, and the implications for their learning. We will explore physical, social and intellectual development and how changes in understanding have influenced educational practices over the years. (APST 1.1)

learning_activities.topic:
Understanding how students learn

In this week's workshop we explore how students learn and the implications for teaching. We will explore the influence of philosophy, cognitive science, psychology and educational research on our current understanding of student learning. This will be positioned in relation to current trends educational practice and public discourse. (APST 1.2)


Learning outcomes: L01, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Understanding how students learn In this week's workshop we explore how students learn and the implications for teaching. We will explore the influence of philosophy, cognitive science, psychology and educational research on our current understanding of student learning. This will be positioned in relation to current trends educational practice and public discourse. (APST 1.2)

learning_activities.topic:
Understanding differentiation

This week we will focus on understanding the history of differentiation, and the various differentiation practices implemented in contemporary primary classrooms. We will explore specific strategies for differentiating teaching to meet the specific learning needs of students across the full range of abilities. (APST 1.2)


Learning outcomes: L01, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Understanding differentiation This week we will focus on understanding the history of differentiation, and the various differentiation practices implemented in contemporary primary classrooms. We will explore specific strategies for differentiating teaching to meet the specific learning needs of students across the full range of abilities. (APST 1.2)

learning_activities.topic:
Understanding subject content and teaching strategies

This week we will focus on understanding the concepts, substance and structure of content across learning areas. This includes distinguishing between educational aims such as established knowledge, understanding core concepts, and developing capability in disciplinary skills and methods. We will explore how these various educational aims require different teaching strategies. (APST 2.5)


Learning outcomes: L01, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Understanding subject content and teaching strategies This week we will focus on understanding the concepts, substance and structure of content across learning areas. This includes distinguishing between educational aims such as established knowledge, understanding core concepts, and developing capability in disciplinary skills and methods. We will explore how these various educational aims require different teaching strategies. (APST 2.5)

learning_activities.topic:
Teaching Literacy and Numeracy

This week we will focus on understanding Literacy and Numeracy as distinct aims within, and beyond, the subjects of Mathematics and English. We will explore specific Literacy and Numeracy strategies. (APST 2.5)

Learning outcomes: L01, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Teaching Literacy and Numeracy This week we will focus on understanding Literacy and Numeracy as distinct aims within, and beyond, the subjects of Mathematics and English. We will explore specific Literacy and Numeracy strategies. (APST 2.5)

learning_activities.topic:
Supporting inclusive student participation and engagement

This week we will explore strategies to support inclusive student participation and engagement in the classroom. This will include exploring the importance various factors including knowing students, positive relationships, classroom culture, differentiation, organisation and clarity of instruction. (APST 4.1; 4.2)



Learning outcomes: L01, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Supporting inclusive student participation and engagement This week we will explore strategies to support inclusive student participation and engagement in the classroom. This will include exploring the importance various factors including knowing students, positive relationships, classroom culture, differentiation, organisation and clarity of instruction. (APST 4.1; 4.2)

learning_activities.topic:
Managing challenging behaviour, and supporting student wellbeing and safety

This week we will focus on practical approaches to manage challenging behaviour; and strategies that support student wellbeing and safety. We will explore well-established classroom management techniques for establishing and maintaining positive learning cultures in the classroom, while also exploring specific strategies to deal with challenging behaviour. (APST 4.3; 4.4)


Learning outcomes: L01, L04
learning_activities.topic_title: Managing challenging behaviour, and supporting student wellbeing and safety
learning_activities.topic_description: Managing challenging behaviour, and supporting student wellbeing and safety This week we will focus on practical approaches to manage challenging behaviour; and strategies that support student wellbeing and safety. We will explore well-established classroom management techniques for establishing and maintaining positive learning cultures in the classroom, while also exploring specific strategies to deal with challenging behaviour. (APST 4.3; 4.4)

learning_activities.topic:
Assessing student learning

This week we will focus on understanding how assessment practices have changed over the years, and how they are currently integrated into contemporary primary classrooms as an integral part of teaching and learning. We will explore the distinctions between informal and formal, formative and summative assessments to better appreciated how and why they are used in the classroom. (APST 5.1)


Learning outcomes: L01, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Assessing student learning This week we will focus on understanding how assessment practices have changed over the years, and how they are currently integrated into contemporary primary classrooms as an integral part of teaching and learning. We will explore the distinctions between informal and formal, formative and summative assessments to better appreciated how and why they are used in the classroom. (APST 5.1)

learning_activities.topic:
Identifying and planning your professional learning needs

This week we focus on understanding how you will use the Australian Professional Standards for Teachers to guide your professional growth as a teacher up to and beyond graduation. We will explore how authentic reflective practice can be used alongside sources of professional learning to improve your practice. (APST 6.1; 6.2)


Learning outcomes: L01, L04
learning_activities.topic_title: Identifying and planning your professional learning needs
learning_activities.topic_description: Identifying and planning your professional learning needs This week we focus on understanding how you will use the Australian Professional Standards for Teachers to guide your professional growth as a teacher up to and beyond graduation. We will explore how authentic reflective practice can be used alongside sources of professional learning to improve your practice. (APST 6.1; 6.2)

learning_activities.topic:
Engaging with parents and carers

This week we will focus on understanding the relationship between schools and families. We will explore some simple strategies for working effectively, sensitively and confidentially with parents/carers. (APST 7.3)


Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Engaging with parents and carers This week we will focus on understanding the relationship between schools and families. We will explore some simple strategies for working effectively, sensitively and confidentially with parents/carers. (APST 7.3)

learning_activities.topic:
Preparation for placement

This week will focus on final preparation for your 2-week block placement, clarifying processes and expectations while on placement. We will explore strategies for establishing a positive and professional relationship with your supervising teacher so that you can make the most of your professional experience. (APST 6.1; 6.2)

Learning outcomes: L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Preparation for placement This week will focus on final preparation for your 2-week block placement, clarifying processes and expectations while on placement. We will explore strategies for establishing a positive and professional relationship with your supervising teacher so that you can make the most of your professional experience. (APST 6.1; 6.2)

School Placement 10 day (2 week) Block

2 weeks (10 days) of full time supervised practicum in a school setting.
